alert.note: Alert for Northern San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued November 24 at 1:02AM PST until November 25 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Wind Advisory: north winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Saturday`s Freeze Watch: near to below freezing temperatures as low as 32 possible. Sunday`s Freeze Watch: near to below freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...Wind Advisory: Portions of the Valley and the Delta, strongest west of Interstate 5. Freeze Watch: Portions of the Valley and Delta. * WHEN...Wind Advisory until 1 PM PST Friday. Freeze Watch on Saturday morning from 2 AM through 9 AM. Freeze Watch also in effect on Sunday morning from 2 AM through 9 AM. * IMPACTS...Wind Advisory: Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Freeze Watch: Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops and other sensitive vegetation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds this morning and coldest temperatures Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
